title: Congratulatory Message from President Tharman Shanmugaratnam to Indian President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the Occasion of India's 75th Republic Day
content:
President Tharman Shanmugaratnam and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong have written to Indian President Droupadi Murmu and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, to convey their congratulations on the occasion of India’s 75th Republic Day on 26 January 2024. The text of the letters are appended.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS SINGAPORE 26 JANUARY 2024
26 January 2024
Her Excellency Droupadi Murmu President Republic of India
Your Excellency,
On behalf of the people of Singapore, I extend my warmest congratulations to Your Excellency and the people of the Republic of India on the auspicious occasion of India’s 75th Republic Day.
Singapore and India share a long and warm partnership, underpinned by close people to people ties and strong cooperation in a multitude of fields. I fondly recall my last visits to India in 2022 and 2023 in my previous capacity as Senior Minister. Singapore and India are also enhancing collaboration in new areas like FinTech, sustainability, and digitalisation. The India-Singapore Ministerial Roundtable is a key platform to drive this enhanced cooperation.
Our countries collaborate well in regional and multilateral fora. I would like to take this opportunity to congratulate you on the successful conclusion of India’s G20 Presidency. Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, Deputy Prime Minister Lawrence Wong and several Singapore ministers attended the various G20 meetings in India. As Country Coordinator for ASEAN-India dialogue relations, Singapore also co-hosted the inaugural ASEAN-India Maritime Exercise with India in May 2023. This reflected the deeper engagement both sides have enjoyed under the ASEAN-India Comprehensive Strategic Partnership which was upgraded in 2022.
I look forward to continuing to work with you to further strengthen ties between our two countries.
I wish you and the people of India peace, good health, and continued success.
Yours sincerely,
THARMAN SHANMUGARATNAM
26 January 2024
Dear Prime Minister Modi,
Please accept my warmest congratulations on the happy occasion of India’s 75th Republic Day.
Singapore and India enjoy a deep and longstanding friendship, underpinned by wide-ranging cooperation in trade, finance, defence, and close people-to-people ties. Through the India-Singapore Ministerial Roundtable, we are also exploring collaboration in new areas like food security, sustainability, upskilling, and digitalisation. You will be pleased to know that the PayNow-Unified Payments Interface linkage that we jointly launched in February 2023 has seen a steady uptake of users. This has made cross-border transactions safer and faster for businesses and individuals on both sides.
I was glad to visit India to meet you and to attend the G20 Summit in September 2023. Under your leadership, India skilfully navigated a multitude of contentious issues to successfully conclude the G20 New Delhi Summit with a consensus Leaders Declaration.
Singapore and India have also cooperated well in ASEAN. Singapore welcomes India’s deepened engagement of the region. Our two countries co-hosted the inaugural ASEAN-India Maritime Exercise in 2023 and adopted joint statements on maritime cooperation and food security at the ASEAN-India Summit in 2023. As country coordinator for ASEAN-India relations, Singapore will maintain the momentum in ASEAN-India relations following its upgrade to a Comprehensive Strategic Partnership in 2022.
I look forward to continuing to work with you to further deepen and strengthen Singapore-India relations.
I wish you good health, happiness, and every success.
Yours sincerely, LEE HSIEN LOONG His Excellency Narendra Modi Prime Minister Republic of India

title: Official Visit by Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan to Lao People's Democratic Republic, 26 to 29 January 2024
content:
Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan will make an Official Visit to Lao People’s Democratic Republic (Lao PDR), from 26 to 29 January 2024 at the invitation of Lao Deputy Prime Minister (DPM) and Minister of Foreign Affairs Saleumxay Kommasith. Minister Balakrishnan will meet senior Lao leaders in Vientiane from 26 to 27 January 2024, and participate in the ASEAN Foreign Ministers’ Retreat in Luang Prabang from 28 to 29 January 2024.
Minister Balakrishnan’s visit kicks off the commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Singapore and Lao PDR. During his visit, Minister Balakrishnan will call on Prime Minister Sonexay Siphandone, meet DPM Saleumxay Kommasith and Lao People’s Revolutionary Party External Relations Committee Head Thongsavanh Phomvihane. They will discuss ways to strengthen bilateral and regional cooperation, including in emerging areas such as renewable energy and carbon credits.
Minister Balakrishnan will also engage Singaporeans in Vientiane and host a reception for Lao alumni of the Singapore Cooperation Programme (SCP). Singapore and Laos have a shared emphasis on human capital development. Since the SCP’s inception in 1992, more than 16,000 Lao officials have attended SCP programmes.
The ASEAN Foreign Ministers’ Retreat is the first high-level meeting of Laos’ 2024 ASEAN Chairmanship under the theme “ASEAN Matters: Enhancing Connectivity and Resilience”. The Foreign Ministers will discuss ASEAN’s priorities for the year, including how to deepen integration in the digital and sustainability spheres, and working with our external partners to maintain an open, inclusive and stable regional order. They will also exchange views on regional and international issues.
Minister Balakrishnan will be accompanied by Mrs Joy Balakrishnan and officials from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS SINGAPORE 25 JANUARY 2024

title: State Visit of President Tharman Shanmugaratnam to Negara Brunei Darussalam, 24 to 26 January 2024
content:
President Tharman Shanmugaratnam is on his first overseas State Visit to Negara Brunei Darussalam. On 24 January 2024, President Tharman met close to 400 members of the Singaporean community in Brunei at a reception. President Tharman, Mrs Jane Ittogi Shanmugaratnam and the delegation also had a welcome dinner with a few younger Bruneian ministers and their spouses.
This morning, President Tharman and Mrs Tharman were accompanied by His Royal Highness Prince Haji Al-Muhtadee Billah, the Crown Prince and Senior Minister at the Prime Minister’s Office of Negara Brunei Darussalam, and Her Royal Highness Paduka Seri Pengiran Anak Isteri Pengiran Anak Sarah to the Istana Nurul Iman, where they were received by His Majesty Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah Mu’izzaddin Waddaulah, the Sultan and Yang Di-Pertuan of Negara Brunei Darussalam, and Her Majesty Raja Isteri Pengiran Anak Hajah Saleha for the Welcome Ceremony.
President Tharman and Mrs Tharman had a royal audience with the Sultan, and the Raja Isteri at the Istana Nurul Iman. This was followed by a bilateral meeting between President Tharman, the Sultan, and their delegations. President Tharman congratulated the Sultan on Brunei’s 40th anniversary of independence. Both leaders reaffirmed the longstanding special relationship between both countries. Noting the significance of the 40th anniversary of diplomatic ties this year, President Tharman and the Sultan looked forward to a series of commemorative events to celebrate this milestone, and agreed to explore specific projects to continue deepening bilateral cooperation.
In the afternoon, President Tharman and Mrs Tharman had lunch with young Bruneian leaders from various sectors. President Tharman welcomed efforts to deepen linkages amongst our young leaders, especially in the areas of sustainable development and inclusivity. He also encouraged the younger generation of Bruneians and Singaporeans to develop personal relationships with each other. President Tharman and Mrs Tharman also visited Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) personnel training in Brunei.
President Tharman and Mrs Tharman will be hosted to a State Banquet this evening at the Istana Nurul Iman by the Sultan and the Raja Isteri.
On 26 January 2024, President Tharman will have a morning walk, a tree planting activity, and breakfast with the Sultan. President Tharman and Mrs Tharman will visit the Yayasan Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah Islamic Calligraphy and Arts Studies Centre in the afternoon before returning to Singapore.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
25 JANUARY 2024

content:

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong will make a working visit to New York City from 24 to 27 January 2024. Prime Minister Lee will be accompanied by Mrs Lee, and officials from the Prime Minister’s Office, and Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

title: Visit by United States Congressional Delegation Led By Representative Young Kim (R-California), 22 January 2024
content:
A United States Congressional delegation is visiting Singapore on 22 January 2024. The delegation is led by House Foreign Affairs Committee Indo-Pacific Subcommittee Chair Representative Young Kim (R-California), and comprises Representatives Debbie Lesko (R-Arizona), Kathy Manning (D-North Carolina), Mariannette Miller-Meeks (R-Iowa) and Jonathan Jackson (D-Illinois).
The Congressional delegation called on Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Finance Lawrence Wong and was hosted to breakfast by Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan. During these engagements, DPM Wong and Minister Balakrishnan reaffirmed the robust and multi-faceted relationship between Singapore and the United States, which is rooted in strong defence and economic cooperation, and welcomed collaboration in new areas. They also exchanged views on global and regional developments, and discussed the importance of upholding the multilateral rules-based order.
The Congressional delegation also met Minister for Defence Dr Ng Eng Hen and Minister for Trade and Industry Gan Kim Yong during their visit to Singapore.

title: Transcript Of Statement By Dr Mohamad Maliki Bin Osman, Minister In The Prime Minister’s Office, Second Minister For Education, And Second Minister For Foreign Affairs At The Third South Summit, Kampala, Uganda, 21 January 2024
content:
Mr Chairman,
Excellencies,
Distinguished colleagues,
I warmly congratulate Uganda for hosting the Third South Summit, and for assuming the chairmanship of the G77&China. I am confident that under Uganda’s chairmanship, we will be able to make significant strides towards building a stronger Global South.
As we celebrate the 60th anniversary of the establishment of the G77&China this year, it is timely to reflect on the strong progress that developing countries have made in human capital development over the last few decades For example, the World Bank estimates that the percentage of people living in extreme poverty has fallen dramatically from about 50% in the 1960s to about 8.8% in 2021.
However, the road ahead has become more uncertain as the world faces a confluence of serious challenges. They include the lingering impact of the pandemic, greater economic volatility due to supply chain disruptions and inflation, as well as the existential challenge of climate change. According to the World Bank, developing countries are projected to grow just 3.9% in 2024, more than one percentage point below the previous decade’s average. Developing countries are disproportionately affected by these challenges, such as how small island developing countries are especially vulnerable to the impact of climate change and extreme weather events.
These challenges have also led to a significant rollback of hard-won development gains According to the UN Department of Economic and Social Affairs (UNDESA), last year, about 238 million people experienced food insecurity, an increase of about 21 million from the previous year. The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) Report released by the UN Secretary-General in 2023 also showed that 30% of SDG targets are stagnating or declining.
As the largest grouping of developing countries at the UN, the G77&China has a unique role in contributing to solutions towards the array of development challenges that we face. We are in a position to amplify the voice of the South on these issues, and work with others within a rules-based multilateral framework to find collective solutions. In particular, we must continue our unwavering efforts towards the collective achievement of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. The 2030 Agenda and the SDGs remain the most critical pathway for ensuring the continued progress of developing countries. The G77&China should build on the SDG Political Declaration adopted at the SDG Summit in September last year. We should also seize opportunities to do more, including at the 4th International Conference on SIDS and the Summit of the Future this year, which will be crucial milestones to push forward the implementation of the SDGs.
Singapore remains committed to working with fellow developing countries to achieve the G77&China’s priorities, particularly in four key areas. First, we need to do more to address the pressing challenge of climate change. The decision by Parties at COP28 to transition away from fossil fuels in energy systems – in a just, orderly, and equitable manner – is a significant and positive development. This will come as a cost – felt more acutely by developing countries. Thus, more must be done to mobilise technology and finance in developing countries so that we may enable greater ambition while supporting sustainable development. While the developed countries must lead the way in this area, there is scope for greater South-South cooperation so that no one is left behind.
Singapore will do our part to support fellow developing countries in ways that we can make a meaningful contribution. For example, atCOP28, Singapore announced various new initiatives to support and accelerate green transition in our region and beyond. This includes the Financing Asia’s Transition Partnership (FAST-P) blended finance initiative, which aims to catalyse up to US$5 billion from concessional and commercial capital providers globally. Singapore also provides technical assistance and capacity-building courses through the Singapore Cooperation Programme, which has seen close to 150,000 participants from over 180 countries, territories, and intergovernmental organisations over the last three decades. Under this programme, we have also launched the Sustainability Action Package to give greater focus to the global sustainability agenda, and share best practices in climate adaptation and resilience.
Second, on trade, we welcome the G77&China’s longstanding commitment to an open and rules-based multilateral trading system. We also echo the G77&China’s concerns regarding unilateral and protectionist measures that run counter to the spirit and rules of the WTO.
Third, on technology. We thank Cuba for making Technology a priority of its G77&China Chairmanship in 2023. Technological advancements offer immense opportunities for development and towards the achievement of the SDGs. However, serious and concerted efforts are required to harness the benefits of technology, including by working with global and community partners to bridge technological and digital divides, and promote greater inclusion and connectivity.
Lastly, transformation of global governance. Governments should work together to build a more inclusive global governance system, including through the reform of key global institutions, to better reflect current realities and respond to emerging challenges. The UN High-Level Advisory Board on Effective Multilateralism had put forth several bold and ambitious proposals, including on repurposing of the multilateral development bank system. We are pleased that some of these proposals have been incorporated in the G77&China’s input to the Pact of the Future. Singapore will continue to work closely with G77&China to ensure that the Summit of the Future will deliver outcomes that benefit all, including developing countries.
In closing, let me reaffirm Singapore’s steadfast commitment to working with fellow developing countries, to ensure that no one is left behind in our journey towards a better tomorrow. Thank you.
Photo Caption: Minister in the Prime Minister's Office, Second Minister for Education and Second Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Mohamad Maliki Bin Osman at the Third South Summit, Kampala, Uganda, 21 January 2024
Photo Credit: Ministry of Foreign Affairs Singapore

title: Congratulatory Letter from Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong to French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal
content:
Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has written to congratulate French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal on his appointment. The text of the letter is appended.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
18 JANUARY 2024
16 January 2024
Dear Prime Minister Attal,
On behalf of the Government of Singapore, please accept my warmest congratulations on your appointment as Prime Minister of the French Republic.
Singapore and France are Strategic Partners enjoying a multi-faceted and substantive relationship. We collaborate extensively in a multitude of areas including trade and investment, energy, defence, innovation, culture, and education. Our economic links are particularly robust, and we are expanding cooperation into emerging areas like the digital and green economies. The Digital and Green Partnership that we signed in 2022 will further help our companies seize opportunities in these fast-growing sectors.
Singapore and France have a longstanding defence partnership. In 2023, we commemorated the 25th anniversary of the Republic of Singapore Air Force’s Advanced Jet Training in Cazaux Air Base. Our Defence Ministries also signed an agreement to establish a joint research and development laboratory that will develop our artificial intelligence capabilities for defence applications.
In 2025, we will celebrate the 60th anniversary of the establishment of our diplomatic relations. I invite you to visit Singapore soon and look forward to working with you to deepen relations between our two countries.
I wish you good health and every success in your new role.
Yours sincerely,
LEE HSIEN LOONG
His Excellency Gabriel Attal
Prime Minister
French Republic

title: Minister in the Prime Minister's Office, Second Minister for Education and Second Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Mohamad Maliki Osman to attend the XIX NAM Summit and the G77 and China Third South Summit, 18 to 22 January 2024
content:
Minister in the Prime Minister’s Office, Second Minister for Education and Second Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Mohamad Maliki Osman will visit Kampala, Uganda from 18 to 22 January 2024 to attend the XIX Summit of the Heads of State and Government of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) and the Group of 77 (G77) and China Third South Summit.
The theme of the XIX NAM Summit is “Deepening Cooperation for Shared Global Affluence”. Member States will address issues of global concern, such as climate change and food insecurity. They will also discuss the importance of upholding international law, deepening cooperation on collective challenges, and strengthening the multilateral system.
The theme of the G77 and China Third South Summit is “Leaving No One Behind”. Member States of the G77 and China will discuss developmental challenges, and ways in which the Group can work towards achieving the Sustainable Development Goals.
Minister Maliki will also have bilateral meetings with his foreign counterparts. He will be accompanied by officials from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
18 JANUARY 2024

title: Visit of Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong to Brunei Darussalam, 13 to 15 January 2024
content:
Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong visited Brunei Darussalam from 13 to 15 January 2024 to attend the wedding celebrations of His Royal Highness Prince ‘Abdul Mateen and Yang Amat Mulia Pengiran Anak Isteri Anisha Rosnah binti Adam at the invitation of His Majesty Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah Mu’izzaddin Waddaulah, the Sultan and Yang di-Pertuan of Brunei Darussalam. Prime Minister Lee was accompanied by Mrs Lee, Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for National Security Teo Chee Hean, and Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan.
Prime Minister Lee and the delegation attended the Royal Wedding Ceremony (Bersanding Ceremony) of His Royal Highness Prince ‘Abdul Mateen and Yang Amat Mulia Pengiran Anak Isteri Anisha Rosnah binti Adam on 14 January 2024. At the Ceremony, Prime Minister Lee and Mrs Lee conveyed Singapore’s heartiest congratulations to His Majesty Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah and Her Majesty Raja Isteri Pengiran Anak Hajah Saleha, and to the royal couple.
Prime Minister Lee had an audience with His Majesty on 15 January 2024. During the audience, both Leaders reaffirmed our shared commitment to the special and enduring relationship between Singapore and Brunei. Prime Minister Lee thanked His Majesty for his strong support for the bilateral relationship over the decades, and expressed his confidence that the next generation of leaders will work closely to take the partnership to greater heights.
Prime Minister Lee separately had an audience with the King of Bhutan His Majesty Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck on the sidelines of the royal wedding, where Prime Minister Lee congratulated His Majesty on the successful conclusion of Bhutan’s General Elections on 9 January 2024. Both Leaders also discussed ways to strengthen bilateral cooperation in various domains.
Prime Minister Lee and the delegation attended the Royal Banquet on 15 January 2024 before they returned to Singapore.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
16 JANUARY 2024

title: Visit of Vice Chairperson of the National Institution for Transformation India Aayog Mr Suman Bery, under the MFA Distinguished Visitors' Programme, 16 to 19 January 2024
content:
Vice Chairperson of the National Institution for Transforming India (NITI) Aayog* Mr Suman Bery will visit Singapore under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs’ Distinguished Visitors Programme (DVP) from 16 to 19 January 2024. Launched in 2005, the DVP invites foreign dignitaries to Singapore to strengthen bilateral ties and foster mutual understanding and cooperation through the exchange of views with Singapore leaders and senior officials. Mr Bery’s visit reflects the close partnership between Singapore and India and our commitment to fostering engagement across all levels.
Mr Bery will call on Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan and be hosted to lunch by Permanent Secretary for Law and Second Permanent Secretary for Foreign Affairs Mr Luke Goh. Mr Bery will also meet Permanent Secretary (Development) for Trade and Industry Dr Beh Swan Gin, Senior Advisor to the Centre for Strategic Futures Mr Peter Ho, and other senior officials from various government agencies to exchange views on current and emerging areas such as urban planning, digitalisation, sustainability, and green financing. In addition, Mr Bery will engage Singapore-based researchers and academics and visit the Singapore City Gallery, Tuas Port and Gardens by the Bay.
*NITI Aayog is the premier public policy think tank and resource centre for the government of India, promoting research and innovation, and providing strategic policy vision on India’s national development and economic priorities.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
16 JANUARY 2024

title: Working Visit of German Federal Minister of Foreign Affairs Annalena Baerbock, 12 January 2024
content:
German Federal Minister of Foreign Affairs Annalena Baerbock visited Singapore on 12 January 2024.
Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan hosted Minister Baerbock to dinner. They reaffirmed the excellent and multifaceted bilateral relations in areas including finance, defence, science, technology and education. Both Ministers noted the good momentum of cooperation and high-level engagements between both sides. Germany is Singapore’s largest goods trading partner in the EU. In 2022, bilateral goods trade was S$24.9 billion, accounting for almost 22% of our total trade in goods with the EU. Singapore is host to more than 2,200 German companies from sectors including chemicals, semiconductors, automotive, engineering, healthcare and logistics.
The EU-Singapore Free Trade Agreement (EUSFTA) and EU-Singapore Investment Protection Agreement (EUSIPA) are key pillars of Singapore’s economic relationship with the EU. Minister Balakrishnan welcomed Germany and the EU’s interest in deepening its engagement with ASEAN in emerging areas including the digital economy, green technology and services, and supply chain resilience. The EUSFTA is the first trade agreement between the EU and an ASEAN Member State and serves as a pathfinder for an eventual ASEAN-EU Free Trade Agreement. Minister Balakrishnan encouraged more German companies to use Singapore as a gateway to tap into the immense economic opportunities in Southeast Asia.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
12 JANUARY 2024
Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan and German Federal Minister of Foreign Affairs Annalena Baerbock in Singapore, 12 January 2024
Photo Credit: Ministry of Foreign Affairs Singapore

title: Official Visit of Crown Prince of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan His Royal Highness Al Hussein Bin Abdullah II, 10 to 12 January 2024
content:
His Royal Highness Al Hussein Bin Abdullah II, Crown Prince of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, received a ceremonial welcome at the Istana this morning. Crown Prince Al Hussein had separate calls on President Tharman Shanmugaratnam and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, who also hosted an Official Lunch in his honour.
President Tharman and Crown Prince Al Hussein reaffirmed the warm ties between Singapore and Jordan, and welcomed the healthy exchange of high-level visits. Prime Minister Lee and Crown Prince Al Hussein discussed ways to strengthen bilateral cooperation in fields such as public administration and Technical and Vocational Education and Training. Prime Minister Lee also encouraged greater people-to-people exchanges between Singapore and Jordan, and conveyed his appreciation for Jordan’s support for the Singaporean student community in Amman and Irbid. President Tharman and Prime Minister Lee had useful exchanges of views with Crown Prince Al Hussein on developments in the Middle East, including the dire humanitarian situation in Gaza.
Six Memoranda of Understanding (MOU) were signed on the sidelines of the visit. The list of MOUs is at Annex. Separately, the Ministry of Communications and Information and the Jordanian Ministry of Digital Economy and Entrepreneurship agreed to explore collaboration in various fields, including skills training and capacity-building in cybersecurity.
During the visit, Crown Prince Al Hussein also met Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Finance Lawrence Wong, and Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for National Security Teo Chee Hean. Crown Prince Al Hussein visited the Gardens by the Bay to officiate the opening of the Jordan Tourism Exhibition and planted an olive tree. Earlier on 11 January, Crown Prince Al Hussein visited the Institute of Technical Education and the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
12 JANUARY 2024

title: PM Lee Hsien Loong to visit Brunei Darussalam (13 - 15 Jan 2024)
content:
Source: PMO
Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong will visit Brunei Darussalam from 13 to 15 January 2024 to attend the wedding celebrations of His Royal Highness Prince ‘Abdul Mateen and Dayang Anisha Rosnah binti Adam at the invitation of His Majesty Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah Mu’izzaddin Waddaulah, the Sultan and Yang di-Pertuan of Brunei Darussalam. Prime Minister Lee will be accompanied by Mrs Lee, Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for National Security Teo Chee Hean, and Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan.
Prime Minister Lee and the delegation will attend the Royal Wedding Ceremony (Bersanding Ceremony) on 14 January 2024 and the Royal Banquet on 15 January 2024, both held at the Istana Nurul Iman. Before the Royal Banquet, Prime Minister Lee and Mrs Lee will also have an audience with His Majesty Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah and Her Majesty Raja Isteri Pengiran Anak Hajah Saleha.
During Prime Minister Lee’s absence, Mr Lawrence Wong, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Finance, will be the Acting Prime Minister from 13 to 15 January 2024.
PRIME MINISTER’S OFFICE
SINGAPORE
12 JANUARY 2024

title: Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan's Written Reply to Parliamentary Question on the Assistance that the Ministry of Foreign Affairs can Offer to (I) Singaporeans who Suffer Serious Injuries Overseas and (II) Singaporeans who have Family Members who Suffer Fatalities Overseas, 10 January 2024
content:
QUESTION
Mr Ang Wei Neng: To ask the Minister for Foreign Affairs what kind of assistance can the Ministry offer to (i) Singaporeans who suffer serious injuries overseas and (ii) Singaporeans who have family members who suffer fatalities overseas.
REPLY
Assisting Singaporeans in distress is a priority for MFA. When we learn of Singaporeans who are seriously injured overseas, our immediate focus is to ascertain their status. We will quickly reach out to local authorities and medical institutions to check on the condition of the affected Singaporeans, and then ensure that they receive the necessary medical attention. We will assist to inform their next-of-kin in Singapore and render consular assistance to these family members. This may include linking them up with local doctors or providing information to facilitate medical repatriation if the families decide to bring their injured loved ones home for treatment.
2 For Singaporeans who have passed away overseas, MFA will advise their next-of-kin on the procedures in relation to funeral services, local cremation, and/or the repatriation of the bodies. We will help the families reach out to the relevant local authorities to obtain the necessary documentation to repatriate the body or the cremated remains.
3 Singaporeans who are travelling overseas are reminded to take precautions to ensure their personal safety. Prior to their departure, Singaporeans are strongly encouraged to monitor the situation at their destinations and eRegister with MFA. Singaporeans are advised to purchase comprehensive travel insurance to cover unexpected expenses, including medical costs, during their overseas trips.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
10 JANUARY 2024

title: Official Visit by Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong to Johor, Malaysia, 11 January 2024
content:
Source: PMO
Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong will visit Johor, Malaysia on 11 January 2024, to attend the commemorative ceremony for the Johor Bahru-Singapore Rapid Transit System (RTS) Link project and witness the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) on the Johor-Singapore Special Economic Zone (JS-SEZ).
Prime Minister Lee and Prime Minister and Minister of Finance of Malaysia Dato’ Seri Anwar Ibrahim will attend the ceremony to commemorate the completion of the connecting span between Singapore and Malaysia for the RTS Link viaduct. When completed, the RTS Link will connect the Bukit Chagar station in Johor Bahru and the Woodlands North station in Singapore, with a peak capacity of up to 10,000 passengers per hour in each direction. It is expected to commence passenger service at the end of 2026.
Following the RTS Link commemorative ceremony, both Prime Ministers will witness the signing of the MOU on the JS-SEZ. The JS-SEZ aims to strengthen economic collaboration in the Iskandar development region by tapping into the complementary strengths of both countries and improving cross-border flows of goods, investments, and people.
Prime Minister Lee will be accompanied by Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan, Minister for Trade and Industry Gan Kim Yong, Minister for National Development Desmond Lee, Acting Minister for Transport Chee Hong Tat, Minister of State for Home Affairs and National Development Faishal Ibrahim, and officials from the Prime Minister’s Office, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Trade and Industry, the Ministry of National Development and the Ministry of Home Affairs.
PRIME MINISTER’S OFFICE SINGAPORE 10 JANUARY 2024

title: Official Visit of Crown Prince of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan His Royal Highness Al Hussein Bin Abdullah II, 10 to 12 January 2024
content:
His Royal Highness Al Hussein Bin Abdullah II, Crown Prince of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, will make his first Official Visit to Singapore at the invitation of Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.
Crown Prince Al Hussein will meet several Singapore leaders during his visit. These include separate calls on President Tharman Shanmugaratnam and Prime Minister Lee, and meetings with Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Finance Lawrence Wong and Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for National Security Teo Chee Hean. Crown Prince Al Hussein will visit the Institute of Technical Education and the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy to discuss cooperation in human capital development.
Crown Prince Al Hussein will be accompanied by his spouse Her Royal Highness Princess Rajwa Al Hussein, as well as His Excellency Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates Ayman Safadi, His Excellency Minister of Digital Economy and Entrepreneurship Ahmad Al Hanandeh, and Her Excellency Minister of Planning and International Cooperation Zeina Toukan.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS

10 JANUARY 2024

title: Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan's Official Visit to Denmark, 6 to 9 January 2024
content:
Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan met Deputy Prime Minister and Defence Minister Troels Lund Poulsen, Foreign Minister Lars Løkke Rasmussen, Minister for Climate, Energy and Utilities Lars Aagaard, and Minister for Digitalisation and Gender Equality Marie Bjerre in Copenhagen.
Minister Balakrishnan and the Danish leaders affirmed the warm and longstanding relations between Singapore and Denmark, underpinned by strong economic links and cooperation in the maritime sector. They discussed how Singapore and Denmark can strengthen cooperation in decarbonisation of the shipping industry, the establishment of green shipping corridors, and work towards achieving net zero emissions. They also welcomed further collaboration in areas of common interest such as renewable energy, sustainable development, AI, digitalisation and digital inclusion, quantum technology and synthetic biology.
Minister Balakrishnan and the Danish leaders also exchanged views on international and regional developments, and underscored the critical importance of ensuring the safety and freedom of navigation through straits used for international navigation, including the Red Sea. This is of vital importance to maritime and shipping hubs like Singapore and Denmark.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS SINGAPORE 9 JANUARY 2024

title: Visit by Senior Minister of State, Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of National Development, Sim Ann to Hunan Province, People's Republic of China, 7 to 9 January 2024
content:
Senior Minister of State (SMS), Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of National Development, Sim Ann visited Changsha, Hunan, from 7 to 9 January 2024. SMS was accompanied by officials from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Enterprise Singapore.
SMS called on Secretary of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Hunan Provincial Committee Shen Xiaoming, and met Standing Committee Member of the CPC Hunan Provincial Committee and Secretary of the CPC Changsha Municipal Committee Wu Guiying. They reaffirmed the warm ties between Singapore and Hunan, and noted the strong presence of Singapore companies in Hunan in areas such as logistics, infrastructure development, sustainability, and education. They discussed ways to strengthen cooperation in areas such as connectivity, urban development, and the green economy, and to facilitate cultural and people-to-people exchanges.
SMS visited Hunan companies and the China (Hunan) Pilot Free Trade Zone to learn more about Hunan’s economic priorities and developments. SMS also engaged representatives of Singapore companies with projects and investments in Hunan.
SMS will return to Singapore this evening.

title: Visit of Senator Claire Chandler, Australian Shadow Assistant Minister for Foreign Affairs, under the MFA Distinguished Visitors’ Programme, 7 to 12 January 2024
content:
Senator Claire Chandler, Australian Shadow Assistant Minister for Foreign Affairs, will visit Singapore under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs’ Distinguished Visitors’ Programme (DVP) from 7 to 12 January 2024. The DVP is the Ministry’s premier visit programme launched in 2005 for distinguished foreign leaders and personalities to visit Singapore to engage Singapore leaders and senior government officials on issues of mutual interest. Senator Chandler’s visit reaffirms the strong bipartisan support in Australia for Singapore-Australia relations.
Senator Chandler will meet Minister in the Prime Minister’s Office, Second Minister for Education and Second Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Mohamad Maliki Osman, Senior Minister of State in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of National Development Sim Ann, Minister of State in the Ministry of Social and Family Development and Ministry of Home Affairs Sun Xueling, Minister of State in the Ministry of Education and Ministry of Manpower Gan Siow Huang, Minister of State in the Ministry of Trade and Industry and Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth Alvin Tan, and Permanent Secretary for Foreign Affairs Albert Chua. She will receive briefings from the Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth, the Inter-Religious Organisation and SportSG.

title: Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan's Official Visit to Portugal, 3 to 6 January 2024
content:
Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan met Portuguese Minister of Foreign Affairs João Gomes Cravinho on 5 January 2024.
They reaffirmed the excellent bilateral ties between Singapore and Portugal. During their meeting, they noted the steady cadence of high-level visits on both sides. In 2022, Singapore’s total trade in goods with Portugal amounted to S$1.6 billion, a 71.6% increase from 2021. Both Ministers agreed to build on the momentum of bilateral and economic ties and deepen cooperation in emerging areas including in innovation and renewable energy.
They also welcomed more business and people-to-people exchanges between Singapore, Portugal and our respective regions. Companies in Portugal can leverage on the EU-Singapore Free Trade Agreement to use Singapore as a gateway to tap into the vast economic potential of Southeast Asia. PSA has been investing in the port of Sines since 2000 and commenced an expansion of its operations worth over €300 million in 2022. Portugal’s largest utility company, Energias de Portugal (EDP), has committed over S$2 billion over the next four years to accelerate green energy transition in Southeast Asia.
Following their meeting, Minister Balakrishnan and Minister Cravinho inaugurated the launch of the Singapore-Portugal Innovation Alliance (SPIA). The SPIA will foster collaboration among startups and technology companies, facilitate greater business networks, and catalyse market entries into Portugal, Singapore, and our respective regions. Minister Balakrishnan’s remarks at the SPIA launch are appended
Minister Balakrishnan also met Mayor of Lisbon Carlos Moedas on 4 January 2024. They exchanged views on Lisbon’s potential as a hub for startups, and agreed to step up exchanges in innovation, housing and public service.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
6 JANUARY 2024
MINISTER FOR FOREIGN AFFAIRS DR VIVIAN BALAKRISHNAN’S REMARKS AT THE INAUGURATION OF THE SINGAPORE-PORTUGAL INNOVATION ALLIANCE
AT THE NOVA SCHOOL OF BUSINESS AND ECONOMICS, LISBON, 5 JANUARY 2024
Your Excellency João Gomes Cravinho, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal
Mr Pedro Oliveira, Dean of the Nova School of Business and Economics
Ms Alexandra Ventura, Executive Director of the Westmont Institute of Tourism and Hospitality
Ms Jacinthe Tay, President of the Board of Directors of the Singapore-Portugal Innovation Alliance
Ladies and Gentlemen
This is a beautiful campus. I can understand why we have so many students from all over the world, including Singapore here.
It is a pleasure to be here this afternoon with my good friend João (Gomes Cravinho) to officiate the inauguration of the Singapore-Portugal Innovation Alliance. As the name suggests, the Alliance has a special emphasis on developing the growth of innovation-driven entities, especially startups and tech companies. Its purpose is to bring together tech innovation companies and stakeholders in the larger ecosystem to foster market entries into Portugal and Singapore, and our respective regions of the world.
It is fitting that we are launching it here in Lisbon, a city that has just been named the European Capital of Innovation last month by the European Commission. We congratulate Lisbon and Portugal for that. If you look around, you can understand why Lisbon is a shining example of how cities can harness innovation and reshape the urban landscape, but more important than that, reshape mental landscapes and perceptions of opportunities for the future. The annual Web Summit held in Lisbon is an iconic event that attracts over 70,000 participants, including leaders and experts in a variety of fields.
Like Portugal, Singapore aims to do more in innovation and entrepreneurship. Through the years, we have established a reputation as one of the leading startup hubs in Asia and indeed, in the world. In 2023, Singapore was ranked 8th in the Global Startup Ecosystem Report. We are committed to building Singapore as a Global Asia Node of innovation, technology, and enterprise. For example, through our Global Innovation Alliance, we help startups and SMEs gain access to overseas partners, ideas, technology and skills. This is needed if our startups are going to be able to grow and become world leading as quickly as possible. Domestically, those of you who have been to Singapore would be familiar with incubators and platforms like BLOCK71 and Startup SG, and the nurture we provide for our startup ecosystem at home.
I am very happy to see the creation of this Alliance. I am even happier this is not something that originated from the government but is a ground-up effort driven by Singaporeans living in Portugal in partnership with collaborators and other stakeholders in Portugal itself. I would like to give special thanks to Jacinthe Tay for her hard work in rallying everyone together for this Alliance. Starting initiatives like this is not easy. Sometimes, it is even harder than a startup as you do not have immediate profit motives or awards for people to sign on. I appreciate how difficult it is. The fact that you have been able to corral a group of merry men and women to join you speaks well for the spirit of enterprise, entrepreneurship, and verve that I hope Singaporeans all over the world will emulate.
There remains great potential for synergy between Singapore and Portugal. We are both small nations, outward oriented, maritime seafaring nations - that confluence of outlook makes us natural partners. The world stands at the threshold of a new revolution involving digital technologies like AI, quantum computing, synthetic biology, and renewable energy to deal with the challenges of climate change. Because we are at an inflection point, this is a moment more than ever before when we need startups and the spirit of innovation and enterprise. Congratulations, and I wish you all the very best.

title: Condolence Letter from Second Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Maliki Osman on Terror Attacks in Iran
content:
Minister in the Prime Minister’s Office, Second Minister for Education and Second Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Mohamad Maliki Osman has written to Dr Hossein Amir Abdollahian, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Islamic Republic of Iran to offer condolences over the 3 January terrorist attacks in the city of Kerman, Iran. The text of the letter is appended.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
6 JANUARY 2024
5 January 2024
His Excellency Dr Hossein Amir-Abdollahian
Minister of Foreign Affairs
Islamic Republic of Iran
Dear Excellency,
I would like to convey my deepest condolences following the twin bomb attacks in Kerman on 3 January 2024. My heartfelt sympathy goes to the families of the victims. I also wish those injured a swift recovery. Singapore strongly condemns these acts of terror.
My thoughts are with you during this difficult time.
Yours sincerely,
DR MOHAMAD MALIKI OSMAN

title: Congratulatory Letter from President Tharman Shanmugaratnam to Kuwait Amir His Highness Sheikh Mishal Al Ahmad Al Jaber Al Sabah
content:
President Tharman Shanmugaratnam has written to Kuwait Amir His Highness Sheikh Mishal Al Ahmad Al Jaber Al Sabah to convey his congratulations on his ascension as the Amir of the State of Kuwait. The text of the letter is appended
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS SINGAPORE 4 JANUARY 2024
2 January 2024
His Highness Sheikh Mishal Al Ahmad Al Jaber Al Sabah Amir State of Kuwait
Your Highness,
Allow me to extend my warmest congratulations on Your Highness’ ascension as the Amir of the State of Kuwait.
Your Highness has a long and distinguished record of public service and commitment to the security and welfare of the Kuwaiti people. I am confident that under Your Highness’ leadership, Kuwait will continue to develop and flourish.
Singapore and Kuwait enjoy a warm and longstanding friendship, underpinned by our shared commitment to a rules-based, multilateral world order. I look forward to working with Your Highness to further deepen the already close ties between our two countries.
Please accept, Your Highness, my best wishes for your continued good health and success
Yours sincerely
Tharman Shanmugaratnam

title: Condolence Letter from Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on the Noto Peninsula Earthquake in Japan
content:
Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has written to Japanese Prime Minister Kishida Fumio to convey condolences on the Noto Peninsula Earthquake in Japan. The text of the letter is appended.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS SINGAPORE 4 JANUARY 2024
4 January 2024
Dear Prime Minister Kishida,
I was deeply saddened by the loss of lives and damage caused by the Noto Peninsula Earthquake on New Year’s Day. On behalf of the Government of Singapore, I extend my heartfelt condolences to the families who have lost loved ones in this disaster. I also wish speedy recovery to the injured. Our thoughts are with you and the people of Japan during this difficult time.
Please let me know if Singapore can be of any assistance in the relief efforts.
Yours sincerely,
Lee Hsien Loong
His Excellency Kishida Fumio Prime Minister Japan

title: Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan’s Official Visit to Portugal and Denmark, 3 to 9 January 2024
content:
Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan will make an official visit to Portugal from 3 to 6 January 2024 and to Denmark from 6 to 9 January 2024.
Minister Balakrishnan’s visit to Portugal will be an opportunity to build on Singapore and Portugal’s close cultural links and deepen cooperation in emerging areas including sustainable development, climate change and biotechnology. In Lisbon, Minister Balakrishnan will deliver the keynote address at the annual Diplomatic Seminar of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Portugal on 4 January. Minister Balakrishnan will also hold a joint press conference with Portuguese Minister of Foreign Affairs João Gomes Cravinho, meet the Mayor of Lisbon Carlos Moedas, and interact with senior Portuguese business leaders.
Minister Balakrishnan’s visit to Denmark underscores Singapore and Denmark’s strong economic, maritime, and people-to-people relations. In Copenhagen, Minister Balakrishnan will meet Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Defence Troels Lund Poulsen, Danish Foreign Minister Lars Løkke Rasmussen, Minister for Climate, Energy and Utilities Lars Aagaard, Minister for Digitalisation Marie Bjerre, as well as senior Danish business leaders.
Minister Balakrishnan will also engage Singaporeans in Portugal and Denmark.
He will be accompanied by officials from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS SINGAPORE 3 JANUARY 2024

title: MFA Spokesperson’s Comments on the Earthquake In Ishikawa Prefecture and Affected Regions in Japan, 2 January 2024
content:
The Singapore Government extends condolences to Japan and the families affected by the Ishikawa earthquake.
MFA has reached out to e-registered Singaporeans in the regions affected by the earthquake and for which tsunami warnings had been issued including Ishikawa, Niigata, Toyama, and Yamagata. Currently, there are no reports of Singaporeans affected. In view of possible aftershocks, Singaporeans in Japan are advised to defer travel to the affected regions, remain vigilant, take all necessary precautions for their personal safety and heed the instructions of the local authorities.
Singaporeans who are in or travelling to Japan are strongly encouraged to e-register with MFA at https://eregister.mfa.gov.sg and purchase comprehensive travel insurance if they have not done so.
Singaporeans in Japan who require consular assistance may contact the Singapore Embassy in Tokyo, or the 24-hour MFA Duty Office at:
Embassy of the Republic of Singapore in Tokyo

MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS SINGAPORE 2 JANUARY 2024

title: Democratic People's Republic of Korea's recent ballistic missile tests
content:
Singapore strongly condemns the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea’s (DPRK) recent ballistic missile launches, including the launch of an Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) on 18 December 2023.
The DPRK’s numerous missile launches are a clear violation of United Nations Security Council Resolutions. They raise tensions on the Korean Peninsula, and jeopardise peace, security, and stability in the region.
Singapore reiterates our longstanding call for the DPRK to cease all provocations immediately and abide by its international obligations and commitments.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
21 DECEMBER 2023

title: Congratulatory Letter from President Tharman Shanmugaratnam to President Abdel Fattah Al Sisi of the Arab Republic of Egypt, 19 December 2023
content:
President Tharman Shanmugaratnam has written to President Abdel Fattah Al Sisi to convey his congratulations on his re-election as President of the Arab Republic of Egypt. The text of the letter is appended
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
20 DECEMBER
19 December 2023
His Excellency Abdel Fattah Al Sisi
President
Arab Republic of Egypt
Your Excellency,
Please accept my congratulations on your re-election as President of the Arab Republic of Egypt.
The strong mandate that you received is especially important in the midst of the conflicts in the region and the key role that Egypt plays in both coordinating humanitarian aid into Gaza and in the pursuit of peace.
Singapore and Egypt enjoy a warm and longstanding partnership, underpinned by strong political, economic, and people-to-people ties. Our cooperation continues to deepen and has expanded into areas like capacity building, civil aviation, and tourism. I look forward to continuing to work with you to further enhance bilateral ties.
Please accept, Your Excellency, my best wishes for your good health and continued success.
Yours sincerely
Tharman Shanmugaratnam

title: Condolence letter from President Tharman Shanmugaratnam on the passing of Amir of the State of Kuwait His Highness Sheikh Nawaf Al Ahmad Al Jaber Al Sabah
content:
President Tharman Shanmugaratnam has written to Amir of the State of Kuwait His Highness Sheikh Mishal Al Ahmad Al Jaber Al Sabah to convey condolences on the passing of His Highness Sheikh Nawaf Al Ahmad Al Jaber Al Sabah. The text of the letter is appended.
MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
SINGAPORE
17 DECEMBER 2023
17 December 2023
His Highness Sheikh Mishal Al Ahmad Al Jaber Al Sabah
Amir
State of Kuwait
Your Highness,
On behalf of the people of Singapore, allow me to express my deepest condolences on the passing of His Highness Sheikh Nawaf Al Ahmad Al Jaber Al Sabah.
His Highness Sheikh Nawaf was a distinguished leaderwho devoted his life to the service of Kuwait. His contributions were instrumental in the development and prosperity of modern Kuwait. His Highness will be dearly missed, in Kuwait and among its partners internationally.
